text:
This is hard for both of us and I’d like to see what you and I can do to reverse course. I’m all ears.
Have a great night! I wish you the best.
Message 1643 of 4024
I think anyone would read your reply to my ask for help.... yet again, as flat out refusal, yet again.
Sent:02/25/2024 at 10:06 PM

Subject:Re: Amex
Message 1644 of 4024
Again... deny what the therapist say. Do your thing, and find blame in others. Dr Brown and Debbie could never be right. Only you are ever right.
Must be great to be so much godamn smarter than everyone else so you can have an affair, lie about it, and blow up our family with no chance of
reconciliation and feel good.
Sent:02/25/2024 at 10:09 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 02/26/2024 at 07:12 AM)
Subject:Re: Domestic Abuse
Message 1645 of 4024
How do we stop fighting, V? Please? I know you think it’s all me and only me, but I really want to stop it. It’s not healthy for us or the kids. What can
I do? Without any dialog it seems impossible. But you are so dead set on ‘no talking’ it’s going to be the death of us. I don’t want to browbeat you, but
please step outside your plan long enough to reflect on its success and trajectory. It only makes us hate more. It’s not helping.
I have offered neutral territory. Stupid peaceful engagement ideas. Possible ways to team up on something non controversial. I don’t know what else
to do, Christine. Please offer anything but the status quo. And please, please don’t just double down yet again. We both say we’re exhausted and want
peace. I’ll try anything different than this. It’s not a loss for you if we win together and make a positive change.
I will literally do anything you ask to make this better.
Sent:02/25/2024 at 10:56 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 02/26/2024 at 05:05 AM)
Subject:Re: Stepping Away
Message 1646 of 4024
I was triggered last night. I am sorry
Sent:02/26/2024 at 05:06 AM
